notes.title: The Role of Dopamine in Human Motivation
notes.content: Dopamine plays a critical role in the brain's reward system and directly influences behavior, focus, and decision-making by reinforcing pleasurable activities.

trash.title: Understanding the Psychological Impact of Digital Minimalism in the Modern Era
trash.content: In recent years, digital minimalism has emerged as a growing trend among individuals seeking mental clarity, reduced stress, and more meaningful interactions in their lives. This philosophy advocates for the intentional reduction of digital distractions—such as social media, constant notifications, and non-essential screen time—in order to focus on what truly matters. Several studies have shown that excessive exposure to digital content can lead to attention fatigue, anxiety, and even symptoms of depression, particularly among young adults and professionals who rely heavily on technology for work or social validation. Adopting digital minimalism often involves reevaluating how and why we use technology, setting boundaries around screen usage, and reintroducing offline habits that promote presence and productivity. While it may be challenging at first to limit digital access in a hyper-connected world, many practitioners report improved sleep, deeper personal relationships, and a stronger sense of purpose as a result. As society continues to grapple with the psychological effects of a tech-dominated lifestyle, digital minimalism offers a compelling framework for healthier engagement with modern tools.
